intro: Cyprianthe asiatica, commonly known as the Asian cyprianthe, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or wetlands. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both horticultural study and ecological research.
